title: This pre-season isn't as bad when...
body: Solo queue was taken away and replaced with flex queue.  Remember that entire year where skill meant considerably less than it used to?

replies.body: Oh god how can anyone who visits the boards forget. Nothing can compare to the amount of hatred dynamic que got. About every 5 minutes the entire gameplay board was refreshed with new hate for dynamic que. It was never ending and went on for the entire season. I hope to never see that much hate ever again.
If I remember correctly it was "i need to play against xyz amount of premades thats why im stuck in silver *cry*". And I bet they still stuck there.

I'm more worried about playing **with** premades :¬) There's something special about being ganged up on by a bunch of friends who don't want to criticize each other, even if you're the one carrying their heavy asses.
Or the troll premades who would all int just to bait you into reacting to try to get you banned.
Oh yeah, in a lot of the 4-man premades theres that *one* AP Zed who forgets he's not just trolling his friends.

I've noticed that too. In premade groups, if a premade laner fucks up and goes 0/10, they did nothing wrong and all is the jungler's fault. Botlane loses? Blame the non-premade support. Also, you get flamed for not following up on plays that were only communicated through their personal discord, no pings or chatting or anything. I am getting very tired of premade jungle-support that don't do anything to warn me that they are going all-in for a gank, then flame me for not tagging along with their amazing synergy.
Don't worry..Soon™.
but one riot coder was basically going "NO! I WORKED VERY HARD CODING THIS AND I REFUSE TO GET RID OF IT"

You mean ghostcrawler. And its not about coding. Its about giving noobs and casuals a way to get higher ranks without any effort. Unfortunately now this approach is still here but more hidden than before.

Lol they split the queues...you can't really complain about the solution they put in place. Dynamic queue is just as much of a mess as normal games with more troll picks. Getting a high rank is freaking impossible if you don't get placed there to begin with.

Rather i think it was a way to incentivize people to play ranked together. From the numbers, people play significantly more when they are playing with their friends. Maybe it was even an incentive for friend groups to have their own ranked team and try to get better together. But it ruined so much for solo players. Flex improved the problem, but I don't like going there either. I get matched with Diamond players as a high silver, which can be cool for improving but often gives quite unfair games. Apart from much higher skill players, there are also a ton of players that play flex when they are tilted and don't want to keep tanking their solo/duo rank, resulting in massive flame.

Forcing people to play with friends is a bad idea.

I have friends, i like playing with them.

They are silver and i'm Platinum 3, because they play the game casually and i tryhard the hell out of it.

So, basically, when we play, either we get matched against silvers and i just stomp the game in <25 minutes or we get matched against gold/plats and they go 0-9 in lane.

Do i have fun playing with them? Yeah, even if we lose is fun.

Do i want my rank to depend on them? no thx.
I agree, I was just commenting on what it think Riot was reasoning when they introduced it

Just sometimes it doesn't matter if you put a lot of work into an idea, at the end of the day, a shitty idea is a shitty idea and no amount of hours put into it is going to fix that.
To be fair nothing was as bad as when riot removed solo queue.

Holy moly, don't remind that season. That was a huge mistake made by Riot. At least they admit it eventually. Disgusting season.

math is fake. 24.11.2017 I bought 2 4800 champs and had around 950 BE. it took me exactly 47 games untill yeasterday to get a little over 5000 BE (I had 4380 BE before the last lvl up yeasterday). I did the math and I did count amount of IP I would get using old IP numbers which are lower (few last patches before preseason IP gains were increased) and still I would get around 5500 IP. Now with those increased numbers I would get surely 6300. So It took me 47 games to get 4800 BE champ even though I had 950 BE already. This is a freaking joke. This system is worse than before. Plus IP boosts were worth much more than XP boosts are worth now.

Ummm no.  No FWotD and assuming you won every game, you would, at _most_ have around 4700 ip in 47 games old system.  And thats if u got the highest amount of ip each time.  The average ip gain on win was 70- 90, losses were 20-40.  You get around 200 xp per game now, so at low levels(30) you'll level up about every 10-15 games which nets you 810 be minimum regardless, or less than that and a discounted champion.  Hence why it is only less be if you play more than ten games a day.

You just pulled the numbers out of your you know what. Check the facts first because i have used the numbers made by riot that you love so much. I took an average game lenght for this patch which is much lowef than in the past and ip scales off how long the game is. My math was done considering 50% win rate. Stop using fake numbers unless you go for to be riot employee then keep going they will hire you insantly.

I still don't understand how we are getting more skin shards in order to compensate for the loss of OE per shard.  We don't get any through leveling and the honor capsules were already out/are half champ shards anyways.

It is just a lie. Just like BE charts and all the other stuff that Riot was lying about. Dont try to find logic and reason when there is nothing to find those in. That "increase" in skin shards doesnt exist. I got first skin from hextech chests after +2 months. I got jax skin that disenchants for 100 OE. Now Im gonna get 90 BE champ shards for another 2 months or more from hextech chests and if I happen to get honor capsule I will get not much more anyway.

It wasn't good, but it wasn't really a surprise. It was spread out a lot. Maybe not clearly enough, but it wasn't a secret. It was mentioned in 4 different places AND the client. First mention 3 weeks before preseason, final week there was notice.

Yes, I remember it. When they announced it they said "in a week or two we will introduce a pure solo queue alongside the dynamic". I was actually looking forward to this. Then Rito was like "just kidding, lul, stay with dynamic". The outcry was really big and TBH that year I was barely playing and I only played one ranked game, and it was by mistake when a friend of mine invited me and I didn't see it was a ranked.

Dynamic Queue was the worst season.  Each season there is always a ton of balance hate, but the only hate that I have ever seen continue for an entire season was Dynamic Queue.  It is also one of the best examples of how if people complain enough, Riot is willing to change things.  Unfortunately, it took waaaaaay more complaining than it should have and it took a whole season to fix.

No. 
Dynamic queue was never removed... The matchmaking was just split into flex and solo/duo.  

People LIKED the new champ select. 
People HATED the new matchmaking. 

To riot, they were one and the same and wouldnt remove their facelift, and it was only after they gave us duo/solo queue specifically that the hate died down.

I mean the issue wasnt it took very long for riot to realize people couldnt change it. The issue was how do you change how the entire ranking system works... mid ranked season. They TRIED to make it work for a while, but everyone hated it. They probably figured next season wouldnt have it after like 4 months.
